utilities
Class stack_info

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--utilities.stack_info
public class stack_info
extends java.lang.Object

Overview
The stack_info class is a collection of static methods to allow users to quickly determine the call stack. This class makes it posible to determine what class called a method & what text files and line numbers resulted in stack calls. The stack_info calls will not appear in return string. By calling the method get_trace a String Array is returned in the following format z = String[x][y] where: z is a two dimensional string array each row (x) represents a call on the stack with the most recent call at row 0 and with the first call as the last row each column (y) is in the following format member 0 : name of text file from which call was made member 1 : line number of text file from which call was made member 2 : method name of calling class member 3 : name of calling class member 4 : full package name of calling class Example of usage: (1) String[][] stack = stack_info.get_trace(true); (1) Note: Results in the stack printing to System.out stream (2) String[][] stack_trace = stack_info.get_trace(false); // get formatted stack trace (2) String calling_class = stack_trace[0][3]; // find calling class name (2) Note: if you use previous lines of code in a subroutine (2) calling_class variable will be the name of the class that (2) called the current method

Version:
1.0 (October 2001)
Author:
Tony Held

Constructor Detail

stack_info

public stack_info()
Method Detail

get_trace

public static java.lang.String[][] get_trace(boolean print_trace)
get_trace method returns a String array which contains formatted stack trace information. Use this class to determine which class and methods resulted in the current methods invocation. Additional information such as text file names and line numbers are also in the formatted text string
Parameters:
print_trace - - true if you want formated stack information printed to System.out
Returns:
2-D String array with stack information with the following format * z = String[x][y] where: z is a two dimensional string array each row (x) represents a call on the stack with the most recent call at row 0 and with the first call as the last row each column (y) is in the following format member 0 : name of text file from which call was made member 1 : line number of text file from which call was made member 2 : method name of calling class member 3 : name of calling class member 4 : full package name of calling class

parse_trace_string

private static java.lang.String[][] parse_trace_string(java.lang.String callStack)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
parse the stack trace into the desired two dimensional string

parse_line

private static java.lang.String[] parse_line(java.lang.String line)
break a line from the stack trace into the format: member 0 : name of text file from which call was made member 1 : line number of text file from which call was made member 2 : method name of calling class member 3 : name of calling class member 4 : full package name of calling class
